I couldn't agree more! The combination of honey and lemon is a match made in heaven, and it's great that you've found a balance that works for you. The rich, caramel-like flavor of the honey does indeed pair beautifully with the brightness of the lemon, creating a lovely harmony of flavors.

Using honey in combination with other sweeteners is also a great approach, as it allows you to balance out the flavor and texture of the dessert. Granulated sugar, in particular, can help to counterbalance the strong flavor of the honey and add a bit of crunch to the texture.

I think it's also worth noting that the type of honey you use can make a big difference in the flavor profile of your dessert. Different types of honey, like clover, manuka, or acacia, have unique flavor profiles that can enhance or change the flavor of your dessert. For example, a lighter honey like clover might be a good choice if you want a more subtle honey flavor, while a stronger honey like manuka might be better suited if you want a more robust flavor.

Have you experimented with different types of honey in your lemon desserts, or do you have a go-to honey that you prefer?
